==German== {{cardinalbox|de|12|13|14|zwölf|vierzehn|ord=dreizehnte}} ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|drīzehan}}, akin to Old Saxon {{m|osx|thriutein}}. Ultimately from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*þritehun}}. Compare {{cog|nl|dertien}}, {{cog|fy|trettjin}}, {{cog|en|thirteen}}, {{cog|da|tretten}}, Gothic [[𐌸𐍂𐌹𐍄𐌰𐌹𐌷𐌿𐌽]] (þritaihun). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈdʀaɪ̯tseːn/}} * {{audio|de|De-dreizehn.ogg|audio}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral}} # {{cln|de|cardinal numbers}} [[thirteen]] ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-cardinal}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|drei}} * {{l|de|dreißig}}, {{l|de|dreissig}} {{qualifier|Switzerland}} * {{l|de|zehn}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
